Description: Limestone drum: from a doorway with two lines of text containing a short offering-formula and a small representation of Ankhhaf, seated. Fair, sunk relief. Much surface flaking through the action of salt.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 66; Part 2, 306.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.15)
Condition: Fair; much surface flaking through the action of salt.
